page.title: 04CULLOMPTON CHURCH
page.content: First recorded vicar was Sir William Chartulary in 1181.The present vicar,Rev.Mapson,lives in a new vicarage,the old vicarage,built in 1820,is now an old people's home. Present parish church was started in 1450,taking 100 years to finish.Beautiful Lane's chapel,built with money from local clothier,was started in 1526. It now costs c.Â£20 000 a year to keep St.Andrews in good repair,the upkeep of the tower and carvings taking most money.As well as church services,a mother and toddler group and youth club are organised.Mr.Mapson enjoys his job but worries about the future.He fears growth of lack of concern for others and perhaps Christianity becoming an underground organisation.
